oai_dc:dc.dc:title: fragment of letter from Charles Dickason to Shadrick Lee about Andersonville Prison
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This small fragment of a letter written by Charles Dickason, who served as a private in Co. G, 176th N.Y. Inf., USA, to Shadrick Lee, who was a private of Co. E, 3rd Tenn. Inf., USA, recalled horrible conditions both men endured in the prison camp at Andersonville, Ga. "What a death to die starving about naked and swarming with vermin while cruel nature was carrying off the bowels in agony and disgust." A "Providential Spring" provided good water that saved many lives.
